measured_by: α parameter of the Q-learning model
justification: “θ = (α, β) represents the participant parameter vector that consists of the learning rate parameter (0 ≤ α ≤ 1) …” – indicating that the construct ‘learning rate’ is operationalised by the α parameter estimated from the Q-learning computational model.

measured_by: β parameter of the Q-learning model
justification: The same sentence states that θ also contains “inverse temperature parameter (β > 0)”, establishing that the psychological construct captured by inverse temperature (often interpreted as decision noise/consistency) is measured via the β parameter in the Q-learning model.
construct: decision consistency / choice stochasticity / inverse temperature
